cards.name: Exeggcute
cards.text: Its six eggs use telepathy to communicate among themselves. It is believed to carry plant genes and the genes of other species.

attacks.name: Continuous Eggsplosion
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 20 damage for each heads.

cards.name: Yanma
cards.text: If it flaps its wings really fast, it can generate shock waves that will shatter windows in the area.

attacks.name: Super Speed
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

cards.name: Yanmega
cards.text: This six-legged Pokémon is easily capable of transporting an adult in flight. The wings on its tail help it stay balanced.

attacks.name: Supersonic
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

cards.name: Roselia
cards.text: Roselia that drink nutritionally rich springwater are said to reveal rare coloration when they bloom.

attacks.name: Petal Dance
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 30 damage for each heads. This Pokémon is now Confused.

cards.name: Roserade
cards.text: With the movements of a dancer, it strikes with whips that are densely lined with poison thorns.

attacks.name: Inviting Poison
attacks.text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon. The new Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Flower Tornado
attacks.text: Move any number of Grass Energy from your Pokémon to your other Pokémon in any way you like.

cards.name: Turtwig
cards.text: It undertakes photosynthesis with its body, making oxygen. The leaf on its head wilts if it is thirsty.

attacks.name: Synthesis
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Grass Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

cards.name: Turtwig
cards.text: It undertakes photosynthesis with its body, making oxygen. The leaf on its head wilts if it is thirsty.

cards.name: Grotle
cards.text: It knows where pure water wells up. It carries fellow Pokémon there on its back.

attacks.name: Mega Drain
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Torterra
cards.text: Small Pokémon occasionally gather on its unmoving back to begin building their nests.

attacks.name: Giga Drain
attacks.text: Heal from this Pokémon the same amount of damage you did to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Earthquake
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to each of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Cherubi
cards.text: It evolves by sucking the energy out of the small ball where it had been storing nutrients.

attacks.name: Surprise Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

cards.name: Cherrim

abilities.name: Weather Guard
abilities.text: Your Grass Pokémon have no Weakness.

cards.text: If it senses strong sunlight, it opens its folded petals to absorb the sun's rays with its whole body.

cards.name: Carnivine
cards.text: It binds itself to trees in marshes. It attracts prey with its sweet-smelling drool and gulps them down.

attacks.name: Chomp Chomp
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Loom Over
attacks.text: This attack does 10 less damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

cards.name: Leafeon-GX

abilities.name: Breath of the Leaves
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, once during your turn (before your attack), you may heal 50 damage from 1 of your Pokémon that has any Energy attached to it.

cards.text: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Grand Bloom-GX
attacks.text: For each of your Benched Basic Pokémon, search your deck for a card that evolves from that Pokémon and put it onto that Pokémon to evolve it. Then, shuffle your deck. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

cards.name: Mow Rotom

abilities.name: Roto Motor
abilities.text: If you have 9 or more Pokémon Tool cards in your discard pile, ignore all Energy in the attack cost of each of this Pokémon's attacks.

cards.text: Its body is composed of plasma. It is known to infiltrate electronic devices and wreak havoc.

attacks.name: Special Mow
attacks.text: Discard a Special Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Shaymin
cards.text: The blooming of Gracidea flowers confers the power of flight upon it. Feelings of gratitude are the message it delivers.

attacks.name: Coax
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 3 Basic Pokémon of different types and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Soothing Scent
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

cards.name: Dewpider
cards.text: It crawls onto the land in search of food. Its water bubble allows it to breathe and protects its soft head.

attacks.name: Bubble
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Araquanid

abilities.name: Water Bubble
abilities.text: Prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from your opponent's Fire Pokémon.

cards.text: It delivers headbutts with the water bubble on its head. Small Pokémon get sucked into the bubble, where they drown.

cards.name: Magmar
cards.text: When angered, it spouts brilliant fire from all over its body. It doesn't calm down until its opponent has burned to ash.

attacks.name: Controlled Burn
attacks.text: Discard the top card of your opponent's deck.

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Magmortar

abilities.name: Incandescent Body
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if this Pokémon is Knocked Out), the Attacking Pokémon is now Burned.

cards.text: From its arm, it launches fireballs hotter than 3,500 degrees Fahrenheit. Its arm starts to melt when it fires a whole barrage.

attacks.name: Fire Blaster
attacks.text: You may discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon. If you do, this attack does 80 more damage.

cards.name: Chimchar
cards.text: The gas made in its belly burns from its rear end. The fire burns weakly when it feels sick.

cards.name: Chimchar
cards.text: The gas made in its belly burns from its rear end. The fire burns weakly when it feels sick.

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage for each heads.

cards.name: Monferno
cards.text: It uses ceilings and walls to launch aerial attacks. Its fiery tail is but one weapon.

attacks.name: Super Singe
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

cards.name: Infernape

abilities.name: Flaming Fighter
abilities.text: Put 6 damage counters instead of 2 on your opponent's Burned Pokémon between turns.

cards.text: It tosses its enemies around with agility. It uses all its limbs to fight in its own unique style.

attacks.name: Burst Punch
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

cards.name: Heat Rotom

abilities.name: Roto Motor
abilities.text: If you have 9 or more Pokémon Tool cards in your discard pile, ignore all Energy in the attack cost of each of this Pokémon's attacks.

cards.text: Its body is composed of plasma. It is known to infiltrate electronic devices and wreak havoc.

cards.name: Salandit
cards.text: Volcanoes or dry, craggy places are its home. It emanates a sweet-smelling poisonous gas that attracts bug Pokémon, then attacks them.

cards.name: Salazzle
cards.text: Filled with pheromones, its poisonous gas can be diluted to use in the production of luscious perfumes.

attacks.name: Panic Poison
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned, Confused, and Poisoned.

attacks.name: Hunter's Nails
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is affected by a Special Condition, this attack does 60 more damage.

cards.name: Turtonator
cards.text: It gushes fire and poisonous gases from its nostrils. Its dung is an explosive substance and can be put to various uses.

attacks.name: Searing Flame
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

cards.name: Alolan Sandshrew
cards.text: An ancient tradition of Alolan festivals, still carried on to this day, is a competition to slide Sandshrew across ice as far as one can.

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage for each heads.

cards.name: Alolan Sandslash
cards.text: This Pokémon's steel spikes are sheathed in ice. Stabs from these spikes cause deep wounds and severe frostbite as well.

attacks.name: Spike Armor
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, if this Pokémon is damaged by an attack (even if this Pokémon is Knocked Out), put 6 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon.

cards.name: Alolan Vulpix
cards.text: It exhales air colder than -58 degrees Fahrenheit. Elderly people in Alola call this Pokémon by an older name—Keokeo.

attacks.name: Roar
attacks.text: Your opponent switches their Active Pokémon with 1 of their Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Piplup
cards.text: Because it is very proud, it hates accepting food from people. Its thick down guards it from cold.

attacks.name: Splatter
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Piplup
cards.text: Because it is very proud, it hates accepting food from people. Its thick down guards it from cold.

cards.name: Prinplup
cards.text: It lives a solitary life. Its wings deliver wicked blows that can snap even the thickest of trees.

attacks.name: Bubble Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Empoleon
cards.text: The three horns that extend from its beak attest to its power. The leader has the biggest horns.

attacks.name: Total Command
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage for each Benched Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's).

attacks.name: Whirlpool
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Buizel
cards.text: It inflates the flotation sac around its neck and pokes its head out of the water to see what is going on.

cards.name: Floatzel
cards.text: Its flotation sac developed as a result of pursuing aquatic prey. It can double as a rubber raft.

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Aqua Blast
attacks.text: Discard a Water Energy from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Snover
cards.text: In the spring, it grows berries with the texture of frozen treats around its belly.

attacks.name: Ice Shard
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Fighting Pokémon, this attack does 40 more damage.

cards.name: Abomasnow

abilities.name: Blessings of the Frost
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may attach a Water Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Pokémon.

cards.text: It lives a quiet life on mountains that are perpetually covered in snow. It hides itself by whipping up blizzards.

attacks.name: Hypno Hammer
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

cards.name: Glaceon-GX

abilities.name: Freezing Gaze
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, your opponent's Pokémon-GX and Pokémon-EX in play, in their hand, and in their discard pile have no Abilities, except for Freezing Gaze.

cards.text: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.text: Its body is composed of plasma. It is known to infiltrate electronic devices and wreak havoc.

attacks.name: Frost Crush
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage times the amount of Energy attached to all of your opponent's Pokémon.

cards.name: Manaphy
cards.text: It starts its life with a wondrous power that permits it to bond with any kind of Pokémon.

attacks.name: Deep Currents
attacks.text: Shuffle 5 Water Energy cards from your discard pile into your deck.

attacks.name: Water Pulse
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

cards.name: Electabuzz
cards.text: Electricity leaks from it in amounts far greater than the amount of electricity it eats.

attacks.name: Thunder
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 30 damage to itself.

cards.name: Electivire
cards.text: When it gets excited, it thumps its chest. With every thud, thunder roars and electric sparks shower all around.

attacks.name: Steel Short
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Metal Pokémon, it is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Shinx

abilities.name: Evolutionary Advantage
abilities.text: If you go second, this Pokémon can evolve during your first turn.

cards.text: All of its fur dazzles if danger is sensed. It flees while the foe is momentarily blinded.

cards.name: Shinx
cards.text: All of its fur dazzles if danger is sensed. It flees while the foe is momentarily blinded.

attacks.name: Charge
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Lightning Energy card and attach it to this Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

cards.name: Luxio
cards.text: Strong electricity courses through the tips of its sharp claws. A light scratch causes fainting in foes.

attacks.name: Disconnect
attacks.text: Your opponent can't play any Item cards from their hand during their next turn.

cards.name: Luxray

abilities.name: Intimidating Fang
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, your opponent's Active Pokémon's attacks do 30 less damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.text: Luxray's ability to see through objects comes in handy when it's scouting for danger.

attacks.name: Volt Bolt
attacks.text: Discard all Lightning Energy from this Pokémon. This attack does 150 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Pachirisu
cards.text: A pair may be seen rubbing their cheek pouches together in an effort to share stored electricity.

attacks.name: Snuggly Generator
attacks.text: For each of your Benched Pokémon that has the Nuzzle attack, search your deck for a Lightning Energy card and attach it to that Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Nuzzle
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Rotom

abilities.name: Roto Motor
abilities.text: If you have 9 or more Pokémon Tool cards in your discard pile, ignore all Energy in the attack cost of each of this Pokémon's attacks.

cards.text: Its body is composed of plasma. It is known to infiltrate electronic devices and wreak havoc.

attacks.name: Plasma Slice
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't attack during your next turn.

cards.name: Drifloon
cards.text: If for some reason its body bursts, its soul spills out with a screaming sound.

attacks.name: Creepy Wind
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

cards.name: Drifblim
cards.text: Even while under careful observation, large flocks of Drifblim flying at dusk will inexplicably disappear from view.

attacks.name: Damage Transport
attacks.text: Move 4 damage counters from each of your Pokémon to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Wind Wheel
attacks.text: Your opponent switches their Active Pokémon with 1 of their Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Spiritomb
cards.text: It was bound to a fissure in an Odd Keystone as punishment for misdeeds 500 years ago.

attacks.name: Lightless World
attacks.text: Put 2 Supporter cards from your discard pile into your hand.

attacks.name: Terrify
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is a Basic Pokémon, it can't attack during your opponent's next turn.

cards.name: Skorupi
cards.text: It burrows under the sand to lie in wait for prey. Its tail claws can inject its prey with a savage poison.

attacks.name: Hone Claws
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon's Pierce attack's base damage is 90.

cards.name: Drapion
cards.text: It has the power in its clawed arms to make scrap of a car. The tips of its claws release poison.

attacks.name: Dangerous Stinger
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed and Poisoned.

cards.name: Croagunk
cards.text: Inflating its poison sacs, it fills the area with an odd sound and hits flinching opponents with a poison jab.

attacks.name: Swagger
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Toxicroak
cards.text: Its knuckle claws secrete a toxin so vile that even a scratch could prove fatal.

attacks.name: Poison Jab
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Exact Revenge
attacks.text: If any of your Fighting Pokémon were Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack during their last turn, this attack does 70 more damage.

cards.name: Giratina ◇

abilities.name: Chaotic Star
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may attach 2 Psychic Energy cards from your hand to it.

cards.text: It was banished for its violence. It silently gazed upon the old world from the Distortion World.

attacks.name: Crisis Dive
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Cresselia
cards.text: Those who sleep holding Cresselia's feather are assured of joyful dreams. It is said to represent the crescent moon.

attacks.name: Lunar Payback
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon. If you do, switch all damage counters on this Pokémon with those on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Psychic
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage times the amount of Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Cosmog
cards.text: Its body is gaseous and frail. It slowly grows as it collects dust from the atmosphere.

attacks.name: Teleport
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Cosmoem
cards.text: There's something accumulating around the black core within its hard shell. People think this Pokémon may come from another world.

attacks.name: Teleport
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Lunala ◇
cards.text: Said to live in another world, this Pokémon devours light, drawing the moonless dark veil of night over the brightness of day.

attacks.name: Full Moon Star
attacks.text: For each of your opponent's Pokémon in play, attach a Psychic Energy card from your discard pile to your Pokémon in any way you like.

attacks.name: Psystorm
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage times the amount of Energy attached to all Pokémon.

cards.name: Dawn Wings Necrozma-GX

abilities.name: Invasion
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if this Pokémon is on your Bench, you may switch it with your Active Pokémon.

cards.text: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Dark Flash
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

attacks.name: Moon's Eclipse-GX
attacks.text: You can use this attack only if you have more Prize cards remaining than your opponent. Prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

cards.name: Cranidos
cards.text: In rock layers where Cranidos fossils are found, the fossilized trunks of trees snapped in two are also often found.

cards.name: Rampardos
cards.text: Records exist of a revived fossil that evolved into Rampardos. It proceeded to escape and then destroy a skyscraper with a headbutt.

attacks.name: Clean Hit
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is an Evolution Pokémon, this attack does 60 more damage.

attacks.name: Wild Crash
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Basic Pokémon, it is Knocked Out.

cards.name: Riolu
cards.text: It's tough enough to run right through the night, and it's also a hard worker, but it's still just a youngster.

attacks.name: Detect
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

cards.name: Lucario

abilities.name: Precognitive Aura
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if you have Garchomp in play, you may search your deck for a card and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

cards.text: They can detect the species of a living being—and its emotions—from over half a mile away. They control auras and hunt their prey in packs.

attacks.name: Missile Jab
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

cards.name: Hippopotas
cards.text: It enshrouds itself with sand to protect itself from germs. It does not enjoy getting wet.

attacks.name: Eleventh Hour Tackle
attacks.text: If there are 3 or fewer cards in your deck, this attack does 130 more damage.

cards.name: Hippowdon
cards.text: It blasts internally stored sand from ports on its body to create a towering twister for attack.

attacks.name: Sand Tomb
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Dust Cannon
attacks.text: This attack does 10 more damage for each Colorless in your opponent's Active Pokémon's Retreat Cost.

cards.name: Passimian

abilities.name: Power Huddle
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, your Passimian's attacks do 30 more damage to your opponent's Active Evolution Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.text: They battle with hard berries for weapons. Their techniques are passed from the boss to the group, generation upon generation.

attacks.name: Rock Hurl
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

cards.name: Murkrow
cards.text: Seen as a symbol of bad luck, it's generally disliked. Yet it gives presents—objects that sparkle or shine—to Trainers it's close to.

attacks.name: Mean Look
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

cards.name: Honchkrow
cards.text: If its Murkrow cronies fail to catch food for it, or if it feels they have betrayed it, it will hunt them down wherever they are and punish them.

attacks.name: Rip and Run
attacks.text: Discard a random card from your opponent's hand. Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Sneasel
cards.text: It uses its claws to poke holes in eggs so it can slurp out the insides. Breeders consider it a scourge and will drive it away or eradicate it.

attacks.name: Sneaky Smash
attacks.text: You can use this attack only if you go second, and only on your first turn. Discard an Energy from 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Ambush
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

cards.name: Weavile
cards.text: They dwell in cold places. This Pokémon's main food source in Alola is Vulpix and Sandshrew, which they carefully divide among their group.

attacks.name: Icy Wind
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Evil Admonition
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage for each of your opponent's Pokémon that has an Ability.

cards.name: Stunky
cards.text: It protects itself by spraying a noxious fluid from its rear. The stench lingers for 24 hours.

attacks.name: Gas Bond
attacks.text: Both Active Pokémon are now Confused.

cards.name: Skuntank
cards.text: It sprays a stinky fluid from its tail. The fluid smells worse the longer it is allowed to fester.

attacks.name: Sticky Smokescreen
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips 2 coins. If either of them is tails, that attack does nothing.

cards.name: Darkrai ◇

abilities.name: Nightmare Star
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may attach 2 Darkness Energy cards from your hand to it.

cards.text: It can lull people to sleep and make them dream. It is active during nights of the new moon.

attacks.name: Abyssal Sleep
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep. Your opponent flips 2 coins instead of 1 between turns. If either of them is tails, that Pokémon is still Asleep.

cards.name: Alolan Diglett
cards.text: Its golden hairs function as sensors. It pokes them out of its burrow to monitor its surroundings.

attacks.name: Iron Head
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 10 damage for each heads.

cards.name: Alolan Dugtrio
cards.text: These Pokémon are cherished in the Alola region, where they are thought to be feminine deities of the land incarnate.

attacks.name: Gold Rush
attacks.text: Discard any number of Metal Energy cards from your hand. This attack does 30 damage for each card you discarded in this way.

cards.name: Magnemite
cards.text: It sends out electromagnetic waves, which let it float through the air. Touching it while it's eating electricity will give you a full-body shock.

attacks.name: Searching Magnet
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 3 Metal Energy cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

cards.name: Magnemite

abilities.name: Solid Unit
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks (both yours and your opponent's).

cards.text: It sends out electromagnetic waves, which let it float through the air. Touching it while it's eating electricity will give you a full-body shock.

cards.name: Magneton
cards.text: It has about three times the electrical power of Magnemite. For some reason, outbreaks of this Pokémon happen when lots of sunspots appear.

attacks.name: Zap Cannon
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't use Zap Cannon during your next turn.

cards.name: Magnezone

abilities.name: Magnetic Circuit
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may attach a Metal Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon.

cards.text: As it zooms through the sky, this Pokémon seems to be receiving signals of unknown origin, while transmitting signals of unknown purpose.

attacks.name: Zap Cannon
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't use Zap Cannon during your next turn.

cards.name: Shieldon
cards.text: This Pokémon lived in primeval jungles. Few enemies would have been willing to square off against its heavily armored face, so it's thought.

attacks.name: Take Down
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

cards.name: Bastiodon

abilities.name: Earthen Shield
abilities.text: Prevent all damage done to your Metal Pokémon by attacks from your opponent's Pokémon that have any Special Energy attached to them.

cards.text: It lived in the same environments as Rampardos. Their fossils have been found together—seemingly from after they'd fought to the finish.

attacks.name: Push Down
attacks.text: You may have your opponent switch their Active Pokémon with 1 of their Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Bronzor
cards.text: Implements shaped like it were discovered in ancient tombs. It is unknown if they are related.

attacks.name: Hypnosis
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

cards.name: Bronzong
cards.text: Ancient people believed that petitioning Bronzong for rain was the way to make crops grow.

attacks.name: Psy Bolt
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Psychic Resonance
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Psychic Pokémon in play, this attack does 60 more damage.

cards.name: Heatran
cards.text: Boiling blood, like magma, circulates through its body. It makes its dwelling place in volcanic caves.

attacks.name: Guard Press
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Boiling Impact
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Solgaleo ◇
cards.text: This Pokémon is said to be a male evolution of Cosmog. At the activation of its third eye, it departs for another world.

attacks.name: Radiant Star
attacks.text: For each of your opponent's Pokémon in play, attach a Metal Energy card from your discard pile to your Pokémon in any way you like.

attacks.name: Corona Impact
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't attack during your next turn.

attacks.name: Meteor Tempest
attacks.text: Discard 3 Energy from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Sun's Eclipse-GX
attacks.text: You can use this attack only if you have more Prize cards remaining than your opponent. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

cards.name: Magearna

abilities.name: Change Clothes
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put a Pokémon Tool card attached to 1 of your Pokémon into your hand.

cards.text: This artificial Pokémon, constructed more than 500 years ago, can understand human speech but cannot itself speak.

cards.name: Morelull
cards.text: It scatters spores that flicker and glow. Anyone seeing these lights falls into a deep slumber.

attacks.name: Flickering Spores
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

cards.name: Shiinotic

abilities.name: Illuminate
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for a Fairy Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

cards.text: Forests where Shiinotic live are treacherous to enter at night. People confused by its strange lights can never find their way home again.

attacks.name: Flickering Spores
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

cards.name: Tapu Lele
cards.text: This guardian deity of Akala is guilelessly cruel. The fragrant aroma of flowers is the source of its energy.

attacks.name: Psywave
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage times the amount of Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Magical Swap
attacks.text: Move any number of damage counters on your opponent's Pokémon to their other Pokémon in any way you like.

cards.name: Alolan Exeggutor
cards.text: Alola is the best environment for this Pokémon. Local people take pride in its appearance, saying this is how Exeggutor ought to look.

attacks.name: Exeggutor's Paradise
attacks.text: For each of your Benched Exeggcute, search your deck for an Alolan Exeggutor or Alolan Exeggutor-GX and put it onto that Exeggcute to evolve it. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Draco Meteor Barrage
attacks.text: Flip a coin for each Grass Energy attached to this Pokémon. This attack does 80 damage for each heads.

cards.name: Gible
cards.text: It skulks in caves, and when prey or an enemy passes by, it leaps out and chomps them. The force of its attack sometimes chips its teeth.

attacks.name: Ascension
attacks.text: Search your deck for a card that evolves from this Pokémon and put it onto this Pokémon to evolve it. Then, shuffle your deck.

cards.name: Gible

abilities.name: Rock Hiding
abilities.text: If this Pokémon has any Fighting Energy attached to it, it has no Retreat Cost.

cards.text: It skulks in caves, and when prey or an enemy passes by, it leaps out and chomps them. The force of its attack sometimes chips its teeth.

cards.name: Gabite
cards.text: Shiny objects are its passion. It can be found in its cave, scarcely moving, its gaze fixed on the jewels it's amassed or Carbink it has caught.

attacks.name: Ascension
attacks.text: Search your deck for a card that evolves from this Pokémon and put it onto this Pokémon to evolve it. Then, shuffle your deck.

cards.name: Garchomp
cards.text: The protuberances on its head serve as sensors. It can even detect distant prey.

attacks.name: Quick Dive
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Royal Blades
attacks.text: If you played Cynthia from your hand during this turn, this attack does 100 more damage.

cards.name: Dialga-GX
cards.text: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Overclock
attacks.text: Draw cards until you have 6 cards in your hand.

attacks.name: Shred
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Timeless-GX
attacks.text: Take another turn after this one. (Skip the between-turns step.) (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

cards.name: Palkia-GX
cards.text: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Spatial Control
attacks.text: Move any number of Energy from your Benched Pokémon to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Hydro Pressure
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage times the amount of Water Energy attached to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Zero Vanish-GX
attacks.text: Shuffle all Energy from each of your opponent's Pokémon into their deck. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

cards.name: Lickitung
cards.text: Its tongue is twice the length of its body. It can be moved like an arm for grabbing food and attacking.

attacks.name: Lap Up
attacks.text: Draw 3 cards.

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 50 damage for each heads.

cards.name: Lickilicky
cards.text: Their saliva contains lots of components that can dissolve anything. The numbness caused by their lick does not dissipate.

attacks.name: Dangerous Lick
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 50 more damage for each heads. If the first flip is tails, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Eevee
cards.text: Current studies show it can evolve into an incredible eight different species of Pokémon.

cards.name: Eevee
cards.text: Possessing an unbalanced and unstable genetic makeup, it conceals many possible evolutions.

attacks.name: Palette of Friends
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage for each different type of Pokémon on your Bench.

cards.name: Buneary
cards.text: When it senses danger, it perks up its ears. On cold nights, it sleeps with its head tucked into its fur.

attacks.name: Weak Kneed
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

cards.name: Lopunny
cards.text: The ears appear to be delicate. If they are touched roughly, it kicks with its graceful legs.

attacks.name: Stompy Stomp
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 40 damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Happy Turn
attacks.text: You may shuffle this Pokémon and all cards attached to it into your deck.

cards.name: Glameow
cards.text: When it's happy, Glameow demonstrates beautiful movements of its tail, like a dancing ribbon.

attacks.name: Gentle Bite
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon's attacks do 40 less damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.name: Purugly
cards.text: To make itself appear intimidatingly beefy, it tightly cinches its waist with its twin tails.

attacks.name: Own the Place
attacks.text: If your opponent has a Stadium card in play, discard it. If you do, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Toss Aside
attacks.text: Discard random cards from your opponent's hand until they have 3 cards in their hand.

cards.name: Fan Rotom

abilities.name: Roto Motor
abilities.text: If you have 9 or more Pokémon Tool cards in your discard pile, ignore all Energy in the attack cost of each of this Pokémon's attacks.

cards.text: Its body is composed of plasma. It is known to infiltrate electronic devices and wreak havoc.

attacks.name: Spinning Fan
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Shaymin
cards.text: The blooming of Gracidea flowers confers the power of flight upon it. Feelings of gratitude are the message it delivers.

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

cards.name: Yungoos
cards.text: It wanders around in a never-ending search for food. At dusk, it collapses from exhaustion and falls asleep on the spot.

attacks.name: Scout
attacks.text: Your opponent reveals their hand.

attacks.name: Take Down
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

cards.name: Gumshoos
cards.text: It adores having Rattata and Raticate for dinner, but as it's diurnal, it never encounters them. This Pokémon boasts incredible patience.

attacks.name: Identify
attacks.text: Your opponent reveals their hand. If you find a Pokémon there, this attack does 80 more damage.

cards.name: Oranguru
cards.text: Deep in the jungle, high in the lofty canopy, this Pokémon abides. On rare occasions, it shows up at the beach to match wits with Slowking.

attacks.name: Resource Management
attacks.text: Put 3 cards from your discard pile on the bottom of your deck in any order.

attacks.name: Profound Knowledge
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

cards.name: Type: Null
cards.text: The heavy control mask it wears suppresses its intrinsic capabilities. This Pokémon has some hidden special power.

attacks.name: Merciless Strike
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, this attack does 30 more damage.

cards.name: Silvally-GX

abilities.name: Gyro Unit
abilities.text: Your Basic Pokémon in play have no Retreat Cost.

cards.text: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Turbo Drive
attacks.text: Attach a basic Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Rebel-GX
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage for each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

cards.name: Drampa
cards.text: This Pokémon is friendly to people and loves children most of all. It comes from deep in the mountains to play with children it likes in town.

attacks.name: Outrage
attacks.text: This attack does 10 more damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Dragon Pulse
attacks.text: Discard the top 2 cards of your deck.

cards.name: Ancient Crystal
cards.text: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.,The Regirock, Regice, Registeel, or Regigigas this card is attached to takes 30 less damage from your opponent's attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Cynthia
cards.text: Shuffle your hand into your deck. Then, draw 6 cards.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Cynthia
cards.text: Shuffle your hand into your deck. Then, draw 6 cards.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Cyrus ◇
cards.text: You can play this card only if your Active Pokémon is a Water or Metal Pokémon.,Your opponent chooses 2 Benched Pokémon and shuffles the others, and all cards attached to them, into their deck.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).,◇ (Prism Star) Rule: You can't have more than 1 ◇ card with the same name in your deck. If a ◇ card would go to the discard pile, put it in the Lost Zone instead.

cards.name: Electric Memory
cards.text: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.,The Silvally-GX this card is attached to is a Lightning Pokémon.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Escape Board
cards.text: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.,The Retreat Cost of the Pokémon this card is attached to is Colorless less, and it can retreat even if it's Asleep or Paralyzed.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Escape Board
cards.text: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.,The Retreat Cost of the Pokémon this card is attached to is Colorless less, and it can retreat even if it's Asleep or Paralyzed.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Fire Memory
cards.text: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.,The Silvally-GX this card is attached to is a Fire Pokémon.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Gardenia
cards.text: Heal 80 damage from 1 of your Pokémon that has any Grass Energy attached to it.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Lillie
cards.text: Draw cards until you have 6 cards in your hand. If it's your first turn, draw cards until you have 8 cards in your hand.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Lillie
cards.text: Draw cards until you have 6 cards in your hand. If it's your first turn, draw cards until you have 8 cards in your hand.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Looker
cards.text: Draw 3 cards from the bottom of your deck.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Looker Whistle
cards.text: Search your deck for up to 2 cards named Looker, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Mars
cards.text: Draw 2 cards. If you do, discard a random card from your opponent's hand.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Missing Clover
cards.text: You may play 4 Missing Clover cards at once. • If you played 1 card, look at the top card of your deck. • If you played 4 cards, take a Prize card. (This effect works one time for 4 cards.),You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Mt. Coronet
cards.text: Once during each player's turn, that player may put 2 Metal Energy cards from their discard pile into their hand.,This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

cards.name: Order Pad
cards.text: Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for an Item card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Pal Pad
cards.text: Shuffle 2 Supporter cards from your discard pile into your deck.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Pokémon Fan Club
cards.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Pokémon, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Unidentified Fossil
cards.text: Play this card as if it were a 60-HP Colorless Basic Pokémon. At any time during your turn (before your attack), you may discard this card from play.,This card can't retreat.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Volkner
cards.text: Search your deck for an Item card and a Lightning Energy card, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Volkner
cards.text: Search your deck for an Item card and a Lightning Energy card, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Super Boost Energy ◇
cards.text: This card provides Colorless Energy.,While this card is attached to a Stage 2 Pokémon, it provides every type of Energy but provides only 1 Energy at a time. If you have 3 or more Stage 2 Pokémon in play, it provides every type of Energy but provides 4 Energy at a time.,◇ (Prism Star) Rule: You can't have more than 1 ◇ card with the same name in your deck. If a ◇ card would go to the discard pile, put it in the Lost Zone instead.

cards.name: Unit Energy GFW
cards.text: This card provides Colorless Energy.,While this card is attached to a Pokémon, it provides Grass, Fire, and Water Energy but provides only 1 Energy at a time.

cards.name: Unit Energy LPM
cards.text: This card provides Colorless Energy.,While this card is attached to a Pokémon, it provides Lightning, Psychic, and Metal Energy but provides only 1 Energy at a time.

cards.name: Leafeon-GX

abilities.name: Breath of the Leaves
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, once during your turn (before your attack), you may heal 50 damage from 1 of your Pokémon that has any Energy attached to it.

cards.text: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Grand Bloom-GX
attacks.text: For each of your Benched Basic Pokémon, search your deck for a card that evolves from that Pokémon and put it onto that Pokémon to evolve it. Then, shuffle your deck. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

cards.text: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.text: If you go first, you can use this attack on your first turn.

attacks.name: Cruel Spike
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Beauty-GX
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage for each Prize card your opponent has taken. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, your opponent's Pokémon-GX and Pokémon-EX in play, in their hand, and in their discard pile have no Abilities, except for Freezing Gaze.

attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage for each damage counter on your opponent's Active Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

cards.text: This card provides Colorless Energy.,While this card is attached to a Pokémon, it provides Grass, Fire, and Water Energy but provides only 1 Energy at a time.

cards.name: Unit Energy LPM
cards.text: This card provides Colorless Energy.,While this card is attached to a Pokémon, it provides Lightning, Psychic, and Metal Energy but provides only 1 Energy at a time.

cards.name: Lunala-GX

abilities.name: Psychic Transfer
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may move a Psychic Energy from 1 of your Pokémon to another of your Pokémon.

cards.text: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Moongeist Beam
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't be healed during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Lunar Fall-GX
attacks.text: Knock Out 1 of your opponent's Basic Pokémon that isn't a Pokémon-GX. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

cards.name: Solgaleo-GX

abilities.name: Ultra Road
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may switch your Active Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

cards.text: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Sunsteel Strike
attacks.text: Discard all Energy from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Sol Burst-GX
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 5 Energy cards and attach them to your Pokémon in any way you like. Then, shuffle your deck. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)
